data.title: Extensions Commands Missing/Confusion from Marketplace (again). Support ext inst
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6

The same problem as in #8024 (that was fixed and closed) but problem remains or has come back. Also see #7973

> 1. Marketplace has guidelines for installing i.e. type `ext inst...`
> 2. In the marketplace copy the link and guidance to install i.e.
> Cmd+P and paste
> 3. commands are missing so does nothing - need to add them back
>
> ![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/16284664/231b1faa-3887-11e6-986e-49e9774156d3.png "Example")

See https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=chenxsan.vscode-standardjs as an example

data.title: [Feature Request] Add feature to disable or grey-out obsolete/deprecated C# methods, attributes, etc on autocomplete
data.body:
Or is this something that should be suggested for Omnisharp instead?

I couldn't find a setting for this, nor find results about it on Google. It would be really helpful to avoid auto-completing obsolete stuff when using an API that has legacy methods and attributes. Greying out things marked Obsolete (and showing them last) - or maybe even disabling them - would be great.

Thanks,
Daniel

data.title: regression: source origin no longer shown in editor header
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0

Steps to Reproduce:
- disable editor tabs
- start node debugging and select internal node module 'module.js' in CALLSTACK

Observe:
With VS Code 1.9.0 the editor header now shows the (bogus) 'path' instead of the 'origin':
![2017-01-05_11-25-49](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/21677374/184c7d82-d33a-11e6-93d7-17438163f4b9.png)

In stable the 'origin' attribute of the source is shown:
![2017-01-05_11-23-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/21677387/2ca44986-d33a-11e6-9791-8480fe39a84f.png)

I've tagged this as 'important' because this makes my current work on #16918 more confusing than necessary.

data.title: Adopt Marketplace large extensions support
Moving unsaved files loses content irreversably
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a file "myFile.ts"
2. create a folder "myFolder"
3. edit "myFile.ts"
4. without saving the file, move it to "myFolder"
5. observe notification about lost unsaved changes
6. click OK.
7. observe the file is empty

The Issue:

To me, this workflow is a big issue. Windows conditioned people to click OK on annoying popup notifications.
I was working on a file for 2 hours, saving it every minute (just like I used to). Then I modified it again and decided to move it to find out that 2 hours worth of work is gone. There is no Ctrl-Z to this. GONE.
Surely it's my fault for quickly dismissing the popup, but people will do that. I'd think it should not be hard to avoid this popup especially after all the great work you guys did with the hot reload.

data.title: [9388] add setting that keeps sidebar from toggling folders/opening files
data.body:
@bpasero : please help to review

This is to implement the feature request #9388 

**Request**: Provide a setting so that only double click opens a file in the editor or expands a folder

**Implementation**:

- add setting `workbench.sideBar.openOnSelect`, default to `true`, which is existing behaviour of VSCode: toggle folders and preview/open files when selected. When set to `false`, only highlight folders and files when selected and toggle/preview when double click
- not sure whether I need to provide i18n translation for the setting

If we can specify which tsconfig.json to use in the workspace, that would be great

data.title: (feature request) Scroll Binding
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 AU

Please, refer to [Vim Scroll Binding](http://vimdoc.sourceforge.net/htmldoc/scroll.html#scroll-binding):

> Occasionally, it is desirable to bind two or more windows together such that
> when one window is scrolled, the other windows are also scrolled.  In Vim,
> windows can be given this behavior by setting the (window-specific)
> 'scrollbind' option.  When a window that has 'scrollbind' set is scrolled, all
> other 'scrollbind' windows are scrolled the same amount, if possible.  The
> behavior of 'scrollbind' can be modified by the 'scrollopt' option.

Its really nice with with 2 VSCode panels, side by side, we can have that option too.

data.title: Allow case sensitive 'Add Selection To Next Find Match'
Use Better Range When Formatting TS Quick Fixes
data.body:
**Bug**
TS 2.2 includes a number of new code actions, such as implementing missing interface methods on classes. TS returns these edits unformatted, so we have to format the document after applying these fixes. This formatting is not always correct using the current logic.

**Fix**
Try to determine the range to format using the set of text edits that TS returns to us. This is not perfect, but it should better match the actual edit that we make using the quick action

data.title: Make settings UI look more like one unit and easier to switch to global/workspace settings
data.body:
#16764 Design task:

- [x] The settings editor currently looks more like two editors.  How can we improve it to look like one unit?

Extend Search to both Default (LHS) and Editable (RHS) settings editors. Search will filter in Default settings where as in Editable settings it highlights settings matched in Default settings.

- [x] Also, how can we support quickly switching between Workspace and User settings without having to go through the app menu.

Show User and Workspace settings as tabs next to Search to easily navigate and discoverable. When there is no workspace, Workspace settings tab is shown disabled.

- [x] [Open Workspace Settings message box opens plain settings.json](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16764)


cc @sandy081

data.title: TypeScript Function Call Completion Inserts Duplicate Call
data.body:
Enable: `"typescript.useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest": true`

Start with a JS File:

```js
function abc (x, y, z) {}

ab(1, 2, 3)
```

Put cursor after `ab` and trigger suggestion. Accept the suggestion for `abc`

**Expected**
In this case, since there is already a set of arguments, we should just complete the line to `abc(1, 2, 3)`

**Actual**
The line is completed to `abc(x, y, z)(1, 2, 3)`

data.title: Show Error Message if TypeScript Settings Update Fails
data.body:
Fixes #18127

Show error messages if the TS workspace or user settings update fails. Currently we always show success messages even if the update fails.

data.title: Minimizer for multiple languages such as php?
data.body:
I was wondering if Visual code has a minimizer for php or any other languages?  

Are there extensions for minimizers for multiple languages for production environments?

data.title: evaluate request should come after initialize request
data.body:
Spun off from #17902, evaluate comes before initialize

```
›From client: evaluate({"expression":"123","context":"watch"})
›From client: initialize({"adapterID":"node","pathFormat":"path","linesStartAt1":true,"columnsStartAt1":true,"supportsVariableType":true,"supportsVariablePaging":true,"supportsRunInTerminalRequest":true})
›To client: {"seq":0,"type":"response","request_seq":1,"command":"evaluate","success":false,"message":"not connected to runtime"}
›To client: {"seq":0,"type":"response","request_seq":2,"command":"initialize","success":true,"body":{"exceptionBreakpointFilters":[{"label":"All Exceptions","filter":"all","default":false},{"label":"Uncaught Exceptions","filter":"uncaught","default":true}],"supportsConfigurationDoneRequest":true,"supportsSetVariable":true,"supportsConditionalBreakpoints":true,"supportsCompletionsRequest":true,"supportsHitConditionalBreakpoints":true}}
```

> And it should call evaluate again at some point after we're attached, or the watch will say 'not connected to runtime' until a breakpoint is hit. The watch could be for some global.

data.title: TypeScript Shows "tsdk Updated" Message Even if the Settings Update Fails
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install a local version of TypeScript in a folder
2. Add an invalid `.vscode/settings.json` file (for example `{,}`)
3. Open the folder in VSCode.
4. Open a js file
5. There should  be an alert about selecting which version of TypeScript to use.
6. Select use bundled or one of the options.

**Expected**
This normally should persist the new `tsdk` setting into `.vscode/settings.json`, but since that is invalid, the setting update fails. We should show a message indicating this happened.

**Actual**
We display a message stating that the settings update succeeded. If you open `.vscode/settings.json`, you see that it in fact has not been updated

data.title: Squigglies disappear when caret on var name
data.body:
- VSCode Version: master, commit c62d20228b84b3aa00269d63f44cab41b357700b
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

(Note: does not occur with Version 1.8.1, Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make a new *.ts file
2. Copy the following contents into the file:

```ts
interface I {
    x: number;
}

class RedSquiggly implements I {

}
```
3.  Place the caret with the mouse so it touches the classname (ie: "RedSquiggly"), endpoints inclusive.
4. Observe that squiggly disappears when the classname gets "highlighted".

Images:
![squiggly_present](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/21661453/047d1386-d289-11e6-8304-08148419b3d7.png)
![squiggly_missing](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/21661454/047d1ae8-d289-11e6-81b4-881eef038a4c.png)
